display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; overflow: hidden; max-height: 270px; max-width: 545px; width: 545px; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;

p.b: Dataframes, each with daily data and columns

div.p: data Data within which the extreme events will be detected; preferably >30 years. A climatology can also be created from these data via the window_half_width and smooth_percentile arguments.

alt_baseline_data Daily baseline data; preferably >30 years. These data will be used unaltered (i.e. not subject to climatology creation). After being left_joined with data, they will appear in the seas_clim_year column, but the user will also need to populate the thresh_clim_year and var_clim_year (the latter is not essential data) columns in order for detect() to work.
alt_clim_ext_data Pre-calculated daily climatology and threshold; 365 or 366 day duration.
alt_clim_raw_data Alternative data to be used for a climatology calculation using one of heatwaveR's internal options that involve setting window_half_width and smooth_percentile.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 104px; white-space: nowrap; overflow-wrap: normal;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 178px; white-space: normal; overflow-wrap: normal;
div.div: Outlined symbols indicate Hobday et al. (2016) processing.

switch.text: Outlined symbols indicate Hobday et al. (2016) processing.
